intro: Spilotantha leathersii, commonly known as the desert leatherscale, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring, typically on slender, branching stems. The plant has a woody base and produces small, leathery leaves that are adapted to arid conditions. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Spilotantha leathersii is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton.
